goals.question: What is the distribution of temperature in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of temperature values in the dataset and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: How does the humidity vary with time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of humidity over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any trends or patterns in the humidity levels over time and understand how they vary with different seasons or weather conditions.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind speed vs temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation or patterns between wind speed and temperature and understand how they affect each other.

goals.question: What is the distribution of pressure in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of pressure values in the dataset and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: How does the precipitation vary with location?
goals.visualization: Map of precipitation levels by location
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any geographical patterns or trends in the precipitation levels and understand how they vary with different locations or weather conditions.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['temperature'].plot(kind='hist', bins=20, alpha=0.7, color='blue', edgecolor='black')
    plt.axvline(data['temperature'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['temperature'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Temperature')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of temperature in the dataset?')
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]
    
    plt.plot(data['date'], data['humidity'], label='Humidity', color='blue')
    plt.xlabel('Time')
    plt.ylabel('Humidity')
    plt.title('How does the humidity vary with time?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['wind_speed'], data['temperature'])
    plt.xlabel('Wind Speed')
    plt.ylabel('Temperature')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and temperature?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.hist(data['pressure'], bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='Pressure')
    plt.axvline(data['pressure'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['pressure'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Pressure')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of pressure in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
from mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1 import make_axes_locatable

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Convert the data to a GeoDataFrame
    gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(data, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(data.longitude, data.latitude))

    # Create a figure and axis
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(10, 6))

    # Plot the GeoDataFrame
    divider = make_axes_locatable(ax)
    cax = divider.append_axes("right", size="5%", pad=0.1)
    gdf.plot(column='precipitation', ax=ax, legend=True, cax=cax, cmap='coolwarm', markersize=10)

    # Set the title
    plt.title('How does the precipitation vary with location?', wrap=True)

    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
from mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1 import make_axes_locatable

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    # Convert the data to a GeoDataFrame
    gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(data, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(data.longitude, data.latitude))

    # Create a figure and axis
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(10, 6))

    # Plot the GeoDataFrame
    divider = make_axes_locatable(ax)
    cax = divider.append_axes("right", size="5%", pad=0.1)
    gdf.plot(column='precipitation', ax=ax, legend=True, cax=cax, cmap='coolwarm', markersize=10)

    # Set the title
    plt.title('How does the precipitation vary with location?', wrap=True)

    return plt

chart = plot(data)
